page.title: 03S.E. LEIGHTON-INDUSTRY
page.content: Within square two there are three small industrial estates. First established was Youngs Development,followed by Greaves Way and finally Cherrycourt Way which is not yet fully occupied.The Youngs Development consists of mainly small units housing light engineering works and a larger manufacturer of ladies and childrens nightwear. Greaves Way is a smaller development of mainly service industries including van hire and haulage. Cherrycourt Way consists of mainly pre-fabricated units, housing various haulage firms and distribution centres.Liptons and Marley Tiles are two large employers of local people. Liptons package tea for export and employ a large number of women on shift work. Marley tiles until recently have manufactured roof tiles and flooring materials.{
